references.paper_title: Flamingo: a visual language model for few-shot learning
references.reason: This paper introduces Flamingo, a foundational visual language model for few-shot learning, which is directly relevant to the concept of Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) explored in the target paper.
This paper is highly influential in the field of large language models (LLMs), a key component of the LMMs studied in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a highly influential model that bridges vision and language, providing a foundation for many of the multimodal models discussed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: CRAFT: Concept recursive activation factorization for explainability
references.reason: This paper introduces a concept-based explainability method (CRAFT) for CNNs which is the inspiration for the novel approach proposed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Implicit multimodal alignment: On the generalization of frozen LLMs to multimodal inputs
references.reason: This paper, also authored by one of the authors of the target paper, provides crucial insights into the internal representations of LLMs when exposed to multimodal inputs, directly addressing a core aspect of the target paper's research.
